intro: Alkanna shattuckia, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Alkanna shattuckia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
